amendment.description: Amendment in the nature of a substitute sought to authorize additional funding for various science, research, and technology programs and agencies including the National Science Foundation, NASA, the Department of Energy, NOAA, and EPA.
amendment.purpose: An amendment in the nature of a substitute, printed as amendment No. 8 in the Congressional Record of May 8, 1996, which would increase overall authorized funding for science programs to $25 billion, $5.3 billion more than called for in the bill.

action.text: Amendment (A009) in the nature of a substitute offered by Mr. Brown (CA).

vote.text: On agreeing to the Brown (CA) amendment (A009) Failed by recorded vote: 176 - 235 (Roll no. 197).
